poem:
Tinnitus  

in the ear's shadow,  
a whisper twirls—  
an unwelcome guest,  
drumming persistently  
on the walls of silence.  
Yet, beyond,  
a breeze unfurls,  
the soft rustle  
of leaves, a sweetness—  
attend to it,  
for in listening  
lies release;  
a gentle promise  
hums beneath the clamor  
to weave your peace.
